titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Craig Keyzer collection, 1955-1987 MS 972
titlestmt.author: Norie Guthrie

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-19 13:01:10 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Craig Keyzer collection
did.abstract: This collection consists of fliers, issues of Public News, and concert recordings on CD.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: When he lived in Houston, Craig Keyzer was a graphic artist for the alt weekly "Public News." A lover of popular music he collected Houston concert recordings ranging from Elvis and The Beatles to Townes van Zandt.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection mainly consists of fliers, 88 issues of Public News, and concert recordings on CD.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.
This material is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Craig Keyzer in April 2021.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Craig Keyzer collection, 1955-1987, MS 972, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Public News has been digitized and is available at: https://texashistory.unt.edu/search/?q=%22public+news%22&t=fulltext

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Craig Keyzer collection must be obtained from the copyright holders. The Woodson Research Center use policy is that researchers assume sole responsibility for any infringement of privacy, literary rights, copyrights, or other rights arising from their use of the archival materials. In addition to any restrictions placed by donors, certain kinds of archival materials are restricted for the life of the creator plus 50 years. These materials include, but are not limited to, student grades, transcripts, and any job applications or recommendations.

did.unittitle: Series I: General files
"Fitz Flyer"
Fliers
Juneteenth Blues Festival programs
Series II: CDs
The Beatles Sam Houston Colosseum Houston, Texas and The Thirteenth Floor Elevators La Maison Club Houston, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tracks include: "Twist and Shout", "She's a Woman", "I Feel Fine", "Dizzy Miss Lizzie", "Ticket to Ride", "Everybody's Tring to Be My Baby", "Can't Buy Me Love", "Baby's in Black", "I Wanna Be Your Man", "A Hard Day's Night", "Help!", "I'm Down", "Levitation", "Rollercoaster", "Fire Engine", "Reverberation", "Don't Fall Down", "Tried to Hide", "Splash 1", "You're Gonna Miss Me", "Monkey Island Kingdom of Heaven", "She Lives in a Time of Her Own".

did.unittitle: 2 CDs: Townes Van Zandt Rockefeller's, Houston, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tracks include: "Coretta", "Just Lookin' For You", "Jokes", "Pancho and Lefty", "Gone, Gone, Blues", "I Ain't Leaving Your Love", "Snowin' on Raton", "Racing in the Streets", "The Catfish Song", "Brand New Companion", "If I Needed You", "La-La-La-Lee, Please Lend Me Your Hand", "The Dollar Bill Blues", "Rex's Blues", "Buckskin Stallion Blues", "Who Do You Love", "The Pueblo Wlatz", "Short-Haired Woman Blues", "You Win Again", "Waitin' Around to Die", "A Lover of Women", "Go Down, Darling", "Maria", "White Firefighter Blues"

scopecontent.p: Tracks include: "See, See Rider", "I Got a Woman", "Love Me", "Trying to Get to You", "All Shook Up", "Love Me Tender", "Johnny B. Goode", "Hound Dog", "Fever", "Polksalad Annie", "Why Me, Lord?", "Suspicious Minds", "I Can't Stop Loving You", "Help Me", "How Great Thou Art", "Let Me Be There", "Funny How Time Slips Away", "Can't Help Falling in Love"
